info.title: BOAVIZTAPI - DEMO
info.description:
# ğŸ¯ Retrieving the impacts of digital elements
This is a quick demo, to see full documentation [click here](http://api.boavizta.org) 
## â¡ï¸Server router 
### Server routers support the following impacts: 
| Impact | ğŸ”¨ Manufacture | ğŸ”Œ Usage |
|--------|----------------|----------|
|   GWP  |        X       |     X    |
|   ADP  |        X       |          |
|   PE   |        X       |          |
## â¡ï¸Cloud router 
### Cloud routers support the following impacts: 
| Impact | ğŸ”¨ Manufacture | ğŸ”Œ Usage |
|--------|----------------|----------|
|   GWP  |        X       |     X    |
|   ADP  |        X       |          |
|   PE   |        X       |          |
## â¡ï¸Component router 
### Component routers support the following impacts: 
| Impact | ğŸ”¨ Manufacture | ğŸ”Œ Usage |
|--------|----------------|----------|
|   GWP  |        X       |          |
|   ADP  |        X       |          |
|   PE   |        X       |          |

get.description:
# âœ”ï¸Server impacts from model name
Retrieve the impacts of a given server name (archetype).
### ğŸ“‹ Model
Uses the [classic server impacts router](#/server/server_impact_by_config_v1_server__post) with a pre-registered model 
### ğŸ‘„ Verbose
If set at true, shows the impacts of each components and the value used for each attributes 
 ### ğŸ“‹ Model name
You can have a list of available server models names [here](#/server/server_get_all_archetype_name_v1_server_all_default_models_get)
 
### ğŸ§® Measure
ğŸ”¨ Manufacture impacts are the sum of the pre-registered components impacts

ğŸ”Œ Usage impacts are measured based on the electrical consumption of the pre-registered model for a year

post.description:
# âœ”ï¸Server impacts from configuration
Retrieve the impacts of a given server configuration.
### ğŸ’¡ Smart complete
All missing components and components attributes are retrieve with the closest available values. If no data are available default maximizing data are used
 ### ğŸ‘„ Verbose
If set at true, shows the impacts of each components and the value used for each attributes 
 ### ğŸ“‹ Archetype
An archetype is a pre-registered server model. An ```archetype``` can be specify in the model object. In case an archetype is specified, all missing data are retrieve from the archetype. You can have a list of available archetype's server models [here](#/server/server_get_all_archetype_name_v1_server_all_default_models_get)
 
### â² Duration
Usage impacts are given for a specific time duration. Duration can be given in :
| time unit | Usage parameter |
|------|-----|
| HOURS | ```hours_use_time``` |
| DAYS | ```days_use_time``` |
| YEARS | ```years_use_time``` |
If no duration is given, **the impact is measured for a year**.
*Note* : units are cumulative
### ğŸ§® Measure
ğŸ”¨ Manufacture impacts are the sum of the components impacts

ğŸ”Œ Usage impacts are measured by multiplying :
* a **duration**

* an **impact factor** (```gwp_factor```, ```pe_factor```, ```adp_factor```) - retrieve with ```usage_location``` if not given

* an **electrical consumption** (```hours_electrical_consumption```) - retrieve with ```workload``` if not given

get.description:
# âœ”ï¸Get all the available server models
Return the name of all pre-registered server models

post.description:
# âœ”ï¸AWS instance impacts from instance type and usage 
### ğŸ“‹ Instance type 
AWS name of the chosen instance. You can retrieve the [list here](#/cloud/server_get_all_archetype_name_v1_cloud_all_aws_instances_get).
### ğŸ‘„ Verbose
If set at true, shows the impacts of each components and the value used for each attributes 
 
### â² Duration
Usage impacts are given for a specific time duration. Duration can be given :
| time unit | Usage parameter |
|------|-----|
| HOURS | ```hours_use_time``` |
| DAYS | ```days_use_time``` |
| YEARS | ```years_use_time``` |
*Note* : units are cumulative
### ğŸ§® Measure 
ğŸ”¨ Manufacture impacts are the sum of the pre-registered components impacts divided by the number of instances host in the physicall server

ğŸ”Œ Usage impacts are measured by multiplying :
* a **duration**

* an **impact factor** (```gwp_factor```, ```pe_factor```, ```adp_factor```) - retrieve with ```usage_location``` if not given

* The ```time``` per load in ```workload``` object. The ```power``` per load is retreive from the ```instance_type```

get.description:
# âœ”ï¸Get all the available aws instances
Return the name of all pre-registered aws instances

post.description:
# âœ”ï¸CPU impacts from configuration ### ğŸ’¡ Smart complete All missing data are retrieve with the closest available values. If no data are available default maximizing data are used ### ğŸ‘„ Verbose If set at true, shows the the values used for each attribute*Components have no units since they represent a single instance of a component.* ### ğŸ§® Measure

cpumanufcriteria = ( cpucoreunits x cpudiesize + 0,491 ) x cpumanuf_diecriteria + cpumanuf_basecriteria

# âœ”ï¸RAM impacts from configuration ### ğŸ’¡ Smart complete All missing data are retrieve with the closest available values. If no data are available default maximizing data are used ### ğŸ‘„ Verbose If set at true, shows the the values used for each attribute*Components have no units since they represent a single instance of a component.* ### ğŸ§® Measure

rammanufcriteria =( ramsize / ramdensity ) x rammanuf_diecriteria + rammanuf_basecriteria

# âœ”ï¸SSD impacts from configuration ### ğŸ’¡ Smart complete All missing data are retrieve with the closest available values. If no data are available default maximizing data are used ### ğŸ‘„ Verbose If set at true, shows the the values used for each attribute*Components have no units since they represent a single instance of a component.* ### ğŸ§® Measure

ssdmanufcriteria = ( ssdsize ssddensity ) x ssdmanuf_diecriteria + ssdmanuf_basecriteria

# âœ”ï¸HDD impacts from configuration
### ğŸ’¡ Smart complete
All missing data are retrieve with the closest available values. If no data are available default maximizing data are used
 ### ğŸ‘„ Verbose
If set at true, shows the the values used for each attribute*Components have no units since they represent a single instance of a component.*
### ğŸ§® Measure
The impacts values are set by default

# âœ”ï¸Motherboard impacts from configuration
### ğŸ’¡ Smart complete
All missing data are retrieve with the closest available values. If no data are available default maximizing data are used
 ### ğŸ‘„ Verbose
If set at true, shows the the values used for each attribute*Components have no units since they represent a single instance of a component.*
### ğŸ§® Measure
The impacts values are set by default

# âœ”ï¸Power supply impacts from configuration ### ğŸ’¡ Smart complete All missing data are retrieve with the closest available values. If no data are available default maximizing data are used ### ğŸ‘„ Verbose If set at true, shows the the values used for each attribute*Components have no units since they represent a single instance of a component.* ### ğŸ§® Measure

psumanufcriteria = psuunitweight x psumanuf_weightcriteria

# âœ”ï¸Case impacts from configuration
### ğŸ’¡ Smart complete
All missing data are retrieve with the closest available values. If no data are available default maximizing data are used
 ### ğŸ‘„ Verbose
If set at true, shows the the values used for each attribute*Components have no units since they represent a single instance of a component.*
### ğŸ§® Measure
The impacts values are set by default
